stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on the new “craft-materials” Course 14 while showing near-finished Course 13, building placeholder assets (plastic cups, cardboard mountains, pins, toothpicks, lamp light) and brainstorming star concepts. He simultaneously tested Course 13 performance on real N64 hardware, discussed engine optimisations, and outlined release/version plans.

development_findings.summary: Course 13 is functionally complete; only the exterior and a few finishing touches remain for Zeina to polish.
development_findings.quote: It's not 100 % done, but I'm just waiting for Zeina to finish some stuff because 13 is mostly done now.

development_findings.summary: Course 14’s theme is a world built from household craft materials (cardboard, crayons, pins, plastic cups, toothpicks, paper, etc.).
development_findings.quote: This is the craft level. It's made out of craft materials, the whole thing.

development_findings.summary: Kaze outlined six provisional star missions for Course 14 involving doodle NPCs, cardboard interiors, and a red-coin area guarded by a toy.
development_findings.quote: Can you tell us all the stars from Course 14? ... First star: There is a Yoshi doodle ... Second star: A Toad doodle ... Third star: There's a Luigi doodle ... Star four: ... Star five: ... and then the 8-bit pipe to Mario Paint.

development_findings.summary: ROM size is capped at 64 MB, influencing all asset decisions.
development_findings.quote: Did you set a limit on the ROM size? Yes, 64 MB.

development_findings.summary: Initial performance test of Course 13 on real N64 shows 25-50 FPS; cloud density can be reduced to keep a 30 FPS floor.
development_findings.quote: I can very easily increase the FPS by just reducing the amount of clouds.

development_findings.summary: Imported F3DEX3 and other engine tweaks have shifted the performance bottleneck from CPU to RSP; Sauraen is now focusing on new microcode.
development_findings.quote: Once you actually optimize the memory throughput, the RSP became the bottleneck ... Sauraen is working on it right now, and he's probably going to come up with a lot of really cool things.

development_findings.summary: New lighting gag: a desk-lamp model positioned above the stage now provides the main light source and lens flare.
development_findings.quote: Do we want a lamp up in the sky as the sun? ... This would look a lot better if I just export.

development_findings.summary: Version strategy: v1 and v1.1 will support both real N64 and emulators; v1.2 will target only real hardware to force emulator authors to catch up.
development_findings.quote: 1.2 is only N64 ... emulators will then technologically have to catch up with the game.

development_findings.summary: Demo plan: once Biobak finishes Course 1 textures, Kaze intends to release a single-course demo within about two months.
development_findings.quote: After that, I'm going to get a demo ready of just the first course ... maybe in the next two months, hopefully.

development_findings.summary: Estimated timeline: remaining main courses plus Bowser and side levels will keep development busy for another six-to-seven months.
development_findings.quote: I'm still going to work on it in six or seven months when this is done.

context_findings.summary: Kaze distrusts traditional sponsorships; will only accept them if the product has merit or he can parody the sponsor (e.g., a prank Raid Shadow Legends video).
context_findings.quote: Generally, I never take sponsorships unless I can think of a way to like fuck them over.

context_findings.summary: Uses ChatGPT tactically—for sponsorship negotiation and potential code optimisation—illustrating a playful, opportunistic approach to AI.
context_findings.quote: I legit just went to ChatGPT and told it make me as much money as possible ... Hopefully it works out.

context_findings.summary: Sees YouTube growth as his best financial/PR avenue post-project and plans to increase video output.
context_findings.quote: Being more of a YouTuber is probably my best way to make more money, and it's also good PR for when I actually make my game.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: parents visited for 10 days, forcing extensive yard work; Kaze dislikes outdoor labor but notes the tan it gave him.
context_findings.quote: My parents were over for 10 days and my dad loves working, so basically the entire 10 days I was just doomed to do yard work.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on fitness: believes physical fitness improves reaction time and mental acuity, originally motivated by competitive gaming.
context_findings.quote: If you want a healthy mind, you kind of need a healthy body ... athletes have better reaction times.

context_findings.summary: Prefers living in Canada over Germany due to lower bureaucracy and friendlier environment.
context_findings.quote: Germany sucks to live in ... I'm just glad I don't live there anymore.

biobak.summary: Trimmed ~400 polygons from a boss-fight area and plans a lower-poly tree replacement.
biobak.quote: So far main area has 400 fewer polis and a shit ton of materials removed ... Removed the trees around the area.

biobak.summary: Will take lead on final textures for Course 13’s main area and Course 1 demo; currently allowed a ‘day off’ tongue-in-cheek by Kaze.

zeina.summary: Responsible for exterior of Course 13 and general polish; currently finishing those elements.
zeina.quote: The outside area still needs some work, but Zeina's working on that.

zeina.summary: Play-tested the new physics in Course 13 and confirmed they feel intuitive.
zeina.quote: I had Zeina test it, and she managed to move pretty well with these physics.

zeina.summary: Sketching concepts for the overworld (Yoshi’s Fruit Islands).
zeina.quote: Zeina was already doing like sketches though; she wanted to make the overworld.

key_stories.title: Using AI to Troll a Sponsor
key_stories.summary: Kaze was approached for a Raid Shadow Legends deal. Rather than decline, he asked ChatGPT to write profit-maximising negotiation emails and devised a prank video that would bury the ad inside hours of Mario 64 wall footage.
key_stories.challenge: Kaze dislikes conventional ads but was still offered a lucrative sponsorship.
key_stories.process: He instructed ChatGPT to negotiate on his behalf and planned a video structure: 1 minute Raid promo, 4 hours of ‘every visible wall’ footage.
key_stories.outcome: Awaiting sponsor response; illustrates Kaze’s anti-ad ethos and playful ingenuity.
key_stories.key_quote: I legit just went to ChatGPT and told it make me as much money as possible and I just sent that to Raid Shadow Legends.

key_stories.title: Course 13 Performance Crunch
key_stories.summary: During a live test on real hardware, Course 13 dipped to 25 FPS. Kaze quickly realised cloud density was the culprit and showed how halving the cloud count restored the target 30 FPS.
key_stories.challenge: Maintain 30 FPS on real N64 despite dense cloud visuals.
key_stories.process: Live profiling, toggling cloud object count, and retesting.
key_stories.outcome: Confirmed a clear optimisation path and set visual/performance guidelines for future areas.
key_stories.key_quote: I can very easily increase the FPS by just reducing the amount of clouds.

key_stories.title: Crafting Course 14
key_stories.summary: Kaze brainstormed and built prototype assets—plastic cups, cardboard mountains, toothpick bridges, desk-lamp sun—for a craft-material themed level, while outlining six star missions built around doodle NPCs.
key_stories.challenge: Invent a cohesive visual language that reads as hand-made yet runs on N64 limits.
key_stories.process: Iterative asset modelling in Blender, UV shortcuts, texture sourcing, and live chat feedback.
key_stories.outcome: A library of low-poly assets and a complete star concept list ready for level block-out.
key_stories.key_quote: This is the craft level. It's made out of craft materials, the whole thing.

open_questions.context: Kaze mentioned the hard limit but did not explain why 64 MB was chosen or how close they currently are to that ceiling.
questions: Why exactly 64 MB? Is it a technical N64 limit, a personal discipline, or future cartridge constraint?
How full is the ROM right now, and what strategies exist if they exceed the cap?
Which asset types are most at risk of blowing the budget?

open_questions.context: Kaze said the RSP is now the bottleneck and that Sauraen is working on microcode improvements.
questions: What specific tasks is the custom microcode expected to accelerate?
How will new microcode integrate with the existing decompilation project?
What risks exist in shipping a build that relies on non-standard microcode?

open_questions.context: He listed six star ideas but called some ‘on the edge’ of being too puzzly.
questions: What criteria determine whether a mission concept is ‘too puzzly’?
How are play-tests structured to validate these criteria?
Were any alternative star ideas rejected, and why?

open_questions.context: Plan to drop emulator compatibility after v1.1 to ‘force’ emulator authors to catch up.
questions: What community backlash does Kaze anticipate from an N64-only v1.2?
Is there a risk of fragmenting the player base?
How will the team measure whether this move actually accelerates emulator development?

open_questions.context: We saw ad-hoc chats with Biobak and Zeina, but little detail on formal processes.
questions: How are tasks assigned and tracked among the remote contributors?
What tools or repositories are shared, given Kaze keeps some private?
